unnormalised: Just a heads up for anyone planning trips! Always double-check the train timings on IRCTC. For example, the Mumbai local might show a 9:15 AM departure but could be delayed by 15-20 mins due to monsoon. Also, remember that flight schedules often use 24-hr format (e.g., 18:45 hrs instead of 6:45 PM). Finally, note that some airlines show arrival times in GMT, so factor in the 5:30 hrs difference to IST when planning your onward journey from say, Delhi airport on 22/12/2024.
normalised: Just a heads up for anyone planning trips! Always double-check the train timings on I-R-C-T-C. For example, the Mumbai local might show a nine fifteen A-M departure but could be delayed by fifteen to twenty minutes due to monsoon. Also, remember that flight schedules often use twenty four hour format, for example, eighteen forty five hours instead of six forty five P-M. Finally, note that some airlines show arrival times in G-M-T, so factor in the five hour thirty minutes difference to I-S-T when planning your onward journey from say, Delhi airport on twenty second December two thousand and twenty four.
